article.Heading: GST Council likely to fast track E-Way Bill in the next meeting
article.Summary: The government has proposed seamless movements of goods of up to Rs 50,000 and there is a proposal to hike this limit to Rs 100,000
article.Body:
It's been a month since the goods and services tax was implemented. However, some issues continue to be a cause of concern. CNBC-TV18 has learnedÂ that the GST council is set to take stock of the situation in its next meeting on August 5. High on the agenda is fast tracking the E-Way Bill and hiking the limit for seamless transportation of goods.

The Council is likely to deliberate upon fast tracking of the issues related to E-Way Bill. The government has proposed seamless movements of goods of up to Rs 50,000 and there is a proposal to hike this limit to Rs 100,000.

The GST Council will also have on its agenda tweaking of rates of several commodities especially for textile sector and hybrid cars after the Japanese government has asked for a relaxation on hybrid cars. Issues relating to rate on MSME and marble sector are also lined up on the agenda.

The government may also review the implementation issues post July 1 GST roll out and anti-profiteering clause.
